page.title: 12ST MARGARETS HIGH STREET
page.content: The village High Street is the major shopping centre between Dover and Deal. There are 13 shops lining both sides of the road comprising; 1 bank,1 post office,1 estate agent,2 news agents,2 gift shops,1 florist,3 food stores,1 greengrocers and 1 butcher. These shops are good enough to provide 1 in 7 families with most of their weekly needs. Of the rest 60% shop in Dover,and 30% in Deal. There are also 2 petrol stations and 5 pubs. Most villagers are happy with their shops but some would like a supermarket and a small number want a chip shop. The appeal of such development is not universal. Many people drive to the village shops and this with the passage of Bay traffic has led to a problem. A Saturday morning survey counted 450 per hour passing the Post Office.
